title: Lacey Kirk Williams
text:
Lacey Kirk Williams (1871, <a href="Eufaula%2C%20Alabama">Eufaula, Alabama</a>-1940) was an <a href="African-American">African-American</a> who became President of the <a href="National%20Baptist%20Convention%2C%20USA%2C%20Inc.">National Baptist Convention</a>. He was appointed Vice President to the <a href="World%20Baptist%20Alliance">World Baptist Alliance</a> in 1928. He died in an aeroplane crash in 1940.
In 1919 he was appointed to the <a href="Chicago%20Commission%20on%20Race%20Relations">Chicago Commission on Race Relations</a>.
